text: A balaclava (or ski mask) is a type of clothing worn over the head. It has holes for eyes, the mouth and the nose. They are normally worn to protect from cold weather, and is often worn by skiers. The name "balaclava" comes from the town of Balaklava, near Sevastopol in Crimea, Ukraine. == References == Category:Protective clothing
title: Balaclava
